description.narrative: Amal is a non-profit association officially created in November 2000 in Tunis.However, the founding group of the association launched their program of support for single mothers since 1992 within the Terre des hommes FoundationLausanne Tunisie. In the beginning, the program was a simple act of charity and assistance to single mothers lacking the means to live in dignity. From 2000, the association's intervention focused on a mission of defending the rights of women living in extreme vulnerability, especially single mothers. In order to guarantee this category of women access to their fundamental rights, the Amal association has opted for the implementation of a multidimensional action program aimed at strengthening their capacities and developing their sensitivity to rights. socioeconomic, sexual and bodily health. Since 2001, Amal has been running an accommodation center for the care of homeless mother and child couples. In addition, its initial beneficiaries, Amal reserved in the same center a protection space dedicated to sub-Saharan women with or without children victims of human trafficking on Tunisian soil. Following twenty years of experience in the field of professional integration of single mothers, Amal set up a vocational training center in2014 to help all women and girls who are victimsof violence and or socioeconomic exclusion. to acquire a professional qualification allowing them to achieve their autonomy and to get out of the infernal circle of violence. Amal wants to contribute to the establishment of a society without discrimination against women, especially single mothers and those who are victims of trafficking, and to help them achieve real autonomy and access to their rights. Also, Amal wants to work for equal opportunities for minors of all origins and social conditions.
